member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsStartDecompressOptions.GetColorMask
member.summary: Gets an array of integer values that represent RGB color masks.
member.returns: An array of 3 integers as follows: ColorMask[0] is the red mask; ColorMask[1] is the green mask; ColorMask[2] is the blue mask.

remarks.para: The color mask is valid only if is set to RasterImageFormat.RawBitfields.
As an example, with 16-bit data arranged as RRR RRGG GGGB BBBB, the masks would be:

pre.code: ColorMask[0] = 0x7C00 ColorMask[1] = 0x0E30 ColorMask[2] = 0x001F

remarks.para: For 32-bit data, the only valid data is RRRR RRRR GGGG GGGG BBBB BBBB. The masks would be:

pre.code: ColorMask[0] = 0xFF0000 ColorMask[1] = 0x00FF00 ColorMask[2] = 0x0000FF

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.StartDecompress.

java.pre: public int[] getColorMask()

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsStartDecompressOptions.SetColorMask(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets the array of integer values that represent RGB color masks.
member.param: An array of 3 integers as follows: ColorMask[0] is the red mask; ColorMask[1] is the green mask; ColorMask[2] is the blue mask.

remarks.para: The color mask is valid only if is set to RasterImageFormat.RawBitfields.
As an example, with 16-bit data arranged as RRR RRGG GGGB BBBB, the masks would be:

pre.code: ColorMask[0] = 0x7C00 ColorMask[1] = 0x0E30 ColorMask[2] = 0x001F

remarks.para: For 32-bit data, the only valid data is RRRR RRRR GGGG GGGG BBBB BBBB. The masks would be:

pre.code: ColorMask[0] = 0xFF0000 ColorMask[1] = 0x00FF00 ColorMask[2] = 0x0000FF

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.StartDecompress.

java.pre: public void setColorMask(int colorMask[])

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRtfLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for loading RTF files as raster images.

remarks.para: Rich Text Format (RTF) files have no physical width or height in pixels. You can use the to control how the final document is rendered as a raster image. For more information, refer to .

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRtfLoadOptions.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color used when rendering RTF documents.
member.value: The background color used when rendering RTF documents. Default value is "white".

remarks.para: Background is the color used to fill the resulting image before rendering the RTF contents on top of it.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRtfOptions
member.summary: Provides extra options for loading RTF files as raster images.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRtfOptions.LoadMetafile(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads the specified RTF file as a Windows Enhanced Metafile.
member.param: The source RTF file.
The 1-based page number to load.
member.returns: The Windows Enhanced Metafile this method creates.

remarks.para: This method uses the following members of the current set in RasterCodecs.Options.RasterizeDocument.Load to determine the page size, resolution and margins:
Also, it uses the following members of the current set in RasterCodecs.Options.Rtf.Load to determine the back color to use:
So you must set these options according to your application needs before calling this method. The number of pages inside the RTF file will depend on the Rasterize Document options.
You must destroy the Windows Enhanced Metafile (EMF) handle this method creates manually using the DeleteEnhMetaFile Windows API.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRtfOptions.Load
member.summary: Gets the options for loading RTF files as raster images.
member.value: The RTF load options.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsFpxLoadOptions
member.summary: Gets the options for loading FPX images.
member.value: The FPX load options.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsFpxLoadOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution to load.
member.value: The resolution to load.

remarks.para: Specify 0 for both dimensions to load the default resolution, which is the highest resolution layer, which corresponds to the image with its FULL DIMENSIONS.
Ex: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X300 and 200X150, then in the default case the codec will load the image at 800X600.

Specify either the desired width or desired height to load, and use 0 to get the default for the other dimension. The load procedure will determine the closest resolution layer, which best fits the user's request.

Ex: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X300 and 200X150 and the user requests an image with width equal to 780 for example, then LEADTOOLS will automatically know that the proper width is 800 and load the image at the (800X600) resolution.
Specify one of the exact sets of dimensions in the file.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor
member.summary: Indicates the pre-defined quality factor for saving images using LEAD Advanced Bitonal Compression (ABC).
member.remarks: For more information and an example, refer to and Compression Quality Factors.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Lossless
member.summary: Lossless compression. This option compresses a 1-bit file and maintains image data unchanged. Highest quality.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.LosslessFast
member.summary: Faster lossless compression than Lossless. This option compresses a 1-bit file and maintains image data unchanged. Highest quality. Does not produce compression ratios as high as Lossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.LossyFast
member.summary: Lossy compression. This is the fastest ABC lossy compression option. Does not produce compression ratios as high as the other lossy options.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.VirtualLossless
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option removes image noisy pixels and compresses it at a smaller file size than Lossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.RemoveBorder
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option removes image border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than VirtualLossless.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Enhance
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than RemoveBorder.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified1
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Enhance. However, it may distort some text or straight lines.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified1Fast
member.summary: Same as Modified1 without the border remove or image clean processes.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified2
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option cleans up the image, removes its border if it exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Modified1. However, it may distort some text or straight lines. Maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified2Fast
member.summary: Lossy compression. This option compresses the image at a smaller file size than Modified1. However, it may distort some text or straight lines. Maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified3
member.summary: Lossy compression. Provides faster encode and decode speed than Modified1 or Modified2. if one exists and compresses it at a smaller file size than Modified1 or Modified2. Provides the maximum compression.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAbcQualityFactor.Modified3Fast
member.summary: Same as Modified3 without the border remove or image clean processes.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for loading TEXT files as raster images.

remarks.para: Text files have no physical width or height in pixels. You can use the to control how the final document is rendered as a raster image. For more information, refer to .

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the LEADTOOLS Txt codec.
member.value: true to enable the LEADTOOLS Txt codecs (Leadtools.Codecs.Txt.dll), false to disable it. Default is false.

remarks.para: When this property is set to false, LEADTOOLS will not attempt to load TEXT files and rasterize them and the Leadtools.Codecs.Txt codecs will not be used.
Enabling the TEXT code will generally hinder performance when the object is attempting to load a file on disk with a wrong or missing a file header.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.FontColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the text font color.
member.value: The text font color.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Highlight
member.summary: Gets or sets the text highlight color.
member.value: The text highlight color.

remarks.para: Highlight is the color used as background for the text paragraphs found in the file. If you do not want to show the highlight color, set its value to the same as or .

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the text background color.
member.value: The text background color.

remarks.para: Background is the color used to fill the resulting image before rendering the text on top of it.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the text font size in points.
member.value: The text font size in points.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.FaceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the text font face name.
member.value: The text font face name.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Bold
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the text font should be bold.
member.value: true to use bold font for the text, false to use normal font.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Italic
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the text font should be italic.
member.value: true to use italic font for the text, false to use normal font.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Underline
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the text font should be underlined.
member.value: true to use underlined font for the text, false to use normal font.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTxtLoadOptions.Strikethrough

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJbigLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for loading JBIG images.

java.pre: public class CodecsJbigLoadOptions

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsJbigLoadOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution to load.
member.value: The resolution to load.

remarks.para: Specify 0 for both dimensions to load the default resolution, which is the highest resolution layer, which corresponds to the image with its FULL DIMENSIONS.
Ex: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X 300 and 200X150, then in the default case the codec will load the image at 800X600.

Specify either the desired width or desired height to load, and use 0 to get the default for the other dimension. The load procedure will determine the closest resolution layer, which best fits the user's request.

Ex: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X 300 and 200X150 and the user requests an image with width equal to 780 for example, then LEADTOOLS will automatically know that the proper width is 800 and load the image at the (800X600) resolution.
Specify one of the exact sets of dimensions in the file.

java.pre: public LeadSize getResolution() public void setResolution(LeadSize value)

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.Id
member.summary: Gets the tag id.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.MetadataType
member.summary: Gets the tagged data type.

value.para: The tagged data type. Valid values are:

item.description: Byte
Byte in the range of 0 to 255
Byte used as signed number in the range of -128 to +127
Byte, with application-defined usage
Two bytes, unsigned
Two bytes, signed
Four bytes, unsigned
Four bytes, signed
Four bytes used as a floating point number
Eight bytes used as a double-precision floating point number
Eight bytes, used as a pair of unsigned long integers, where the first number is the numerator and the second is the denominator of a fraction
Eight bytes, used as a pair of signed long integers, where the first number is the numerator and the second is the denominator of a fraction

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.TagFound.

java.pre: public RasterTagMetadataDataType getMetadataType()

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEnumTagsEventArgs.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements.
member.value: The number of elements of type . Note that this is not the same as the number of bytes. For example, if is 10 and is RasterTagMetadataDataType.Int32, you will need 10 x 4 = 40 bytes to read the tag data
member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.TagFound.

java.pre: public int getCount()

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEcwLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides options specifically for loading ECW images.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsEcwLoadOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution to load.
member.value: The resolution to load.

remarks.para: Specify 0 for both dimensions to load the default resolution, which is the highest resolution layer, which corresponds to the image with its FULL DIMENSIONS.
Scenario 1: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X300 and 200X150, then in the default case the codec will load the image at 800X600.

Specify either the desired width or desired height to load, and use 0 to get the default for the other dimension. The load procedure will determine the closest resolution layer, which best fits the user's request.

Scenario 2: If the file contains the image at the following dimensions: 800X600, 400X300 and 200X150 and the user requests an image with width equal to 780 for example, then LEADTOOLS will automatically know that the proper width is 800 and load the image at the (800X600) resolution.
Specify one of the exact sets of dimensions in the file.

Adobe Acrobat PDF version 1.4

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterPdfInfo
member.summary: Contains information for a raster PDF file created with the LEADTOOLS Raster PDF plug in.

remarks.para: The various RasterCodecs.GetInformation methods are used to return information about a raster image file on disk or stream. Information such as the format, size, dimension, bits per pixel are returned as members of the object returned from RasterCodecs.GetInformation.

Raster Adobe PDF saved with the various methods (using any of the RasterImageFormat.RasPdfXyz flavors), contain extra information that can be obtained using RasterCodecs.GetRasterPdfInfo. This method return an instance of filled with these extra information as follows:

description.para: true if the source file was created with the LEADTOOLS Raster PDF plug in, false; otherwise. If the value of this property is true, then other members of this structure are guaranteed to contain accurate information. If the value of this property is false and is one of the PDF flavors (RasterImageFormat.RasPdfXyz, then the source file is a PDF not created with LEADTOOLS, and the other members of this structure may not be guaranteed to contain accurate information (except for , , and ). If this property is true, then calling RasterCodecs.DeletePage is guaranteed to work on this file.

The bits per pixel value of the raster PDF page. This is the same value used as the bitsPerPixel parameter value to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file. You can set the value of CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DisplayDepth to this value to load a PDF page in the original bits per pixel value it was saved at.

The format (compression type) of the raster PDF page, one of RasterImageFormat.RasPdfXyz. This is the same value used as the format parameter value to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file.
The width of the page in pixels. This is the same width of the object to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file.
The height of the page in pixels. This is the same height of the object to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file.

The horizontal resolution of the page in dots per inch. This is the same horizontal resolution of the object to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file if CodecsPdfSaveOptions.UseImageResolution was set to true.

The vertical resolution of the page in dots per inch. This is the same vertical resolution of the object to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file. if CodecsPdfSaveOptions.UseImageResolution was set to true.
The version of the PDF file. This is the same value as CodecsPdfSaveOptions.Version used when saving this file with the RasterCodecs.Save method.

example.para: This example will create a multi-page raster PDF file with each page having its own size, compression and bits/pixel, then use to split this file into several pages with each page saved with the original compression, size, dimension obtained from the file directly.

java.pre: public final class CodecsRasterPdfInfo

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterPdfInfo.IsLeadPdf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the PDF file was created with the LEADTOOLS Raster PDF plug in.
member.value: true if the PDF file was created with the LEADTOOLS Raster PDF plug in, false; otherwise.

remarks.para: If the value of this property is true, then other members of this structure are guaranteed to contain accurate information. If the value of this property is false and is one of the PDF flavors (RasterImageFormat.RasPdfXyz, then the source file is a PDF not created with LEADTOOLS, and the other members of this structure may not be guaranteed to contain accurate information. If this property is true, then calling RasterCodecs.DeletePage is guaranteed to work on this file.

remarks.para: The bits per pixel value of the raster PDF page. This is the same value used as the bitsPerPixel parameter value to the RasterCodecs.Save method used to create this file. You can set the value of CodecsPdfLoadOptions.DisplayDepth to this value to load a PDF page in the original bits per pixel value it was saved at.
This property is guaranteed to contain accurate information only if the value of is true.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAsyncCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: Base class for the and classes.

remarks.para: The class supports asynchronous operations for getting information and loading images through the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync and RasterCodecs.LoadAsync methods. These methods will not block the calling thread and perform their work in the background. When the operation is completed, the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted or RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted events will fire with the operation status and result.
Both of these events use as data arguments the objects of classes derived from . For more information, refer to and .
The class derives from the .NET System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs class and uses these class properties to provide information about the status of the asynchronous operation.

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted and RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted

member.name: M:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAsyncCompletedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Uri,System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates new instance of the with the specified parameters.
member.param: The this asynchronous operation is using.
The this asynchronous operation is using.
The file name this asynchronous operation is using.
Any error that occurred during the asynchronous operation.
A value indicating whether the asynchronous operation was canceled.
The optional user-supplied state object passed to the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync or RasterCodecs.LoadAsync method that initialized the construction of this object.
member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted and RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsAsyncCompletedEventArgs.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI this asynchronous operation is using.
member.value: The this asynchronous operation is using.

remarks.para: Only one of the following can be a valid value (not a null reference) at any time: , or . The property that contains a valid reference depends on what version of RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync or RasterCodecs.LoadAsync method has been called.

For example, if RasterCodecs.LoadAsync(Uri uri, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same URI passed to the method while and will both be null. If RasterCodecs.LoadAsync(String fileName, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same file name string value passed to the method while and will both be null and so on.

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted and RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsGetInformationAsyncCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains data for the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event.

remarks.para: The class supports getting information on image files asynchronously using the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync methods. When calling any of these methods, the caller thread will not be blocked and the method will return instantly with an instance of that is in a loading status (RasterImage.IsLoading is set to true). Do not use the other properties of this object while the object is loading.

When the object finishes getting the information about the file, the various properties of the will be populated with the image file information and the RasterImage.IsLoading property will be set to false.

Do not poll the RasterImage.IsLoading property to determine whether the image information has been collected. Instead, subscribe to the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event to get notification on when the operation is completed and whether any errors occurred.

The RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event data will also contain the same object returned from RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync so you do not have to keep the original object in your application.
The RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event uses a data argument object. This class contains the following properties:

description.para: Contains the URI, stream or file name passed to the method that initialized this asynchronous operation.

Only one of these properties can be a valid value (not a null reference) at any time. The property that contains a valid reference depends on which version of RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync method has been called.

For example, if RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync(Uri uri, bool totalPages, int pageNumberobject, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same URI passed to the method while and will both be null. If RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync(string fileName, bool totalPages, int pageNumberobject, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same file name string value passed to the method while and will both be null and so on.

Contains the class instance that contains the information about the image file. This instance is the same object returned from the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync method. While the asynchronous operation is running, the value of theRasterImage.IsLoading property will be true, indicating that the object is being populated with the information and should not be used. When the asynchronous operation completes, the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event will fire and Info will contain the final and ready to use object. If an error occurs, this property will be set to null and the object is disposed internally by the toolkit.

Contains any errors that might have occurred during the asynchronous operation. You must check this value when the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event fires and make sure it does not contain a valid object.
Contains a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation has been canceled. For example, by calling RasterCodecs.CancelAsync when using RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync with a URL

java.pre: public class CodecsGetInformationAsyncCompletedEvent extends CodecsAsyncCompletedEvent

A value indicating whether the asynchronous operation was canceled.
The optional user-supplied state object passed to the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync or RasterCodecs.LoadAsync method that initialized the construction of this object.

java.pre: public CodecsGetInformationAsyncCompletedEvent(Object source, CodecsImageInfo info, ILeadStream stream, RuntimeException error, boolean cancelled, Object userState)

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsGetInformationAsyncCompletedEventArgs.Info
member.summary: Gets the class instance that contains the information about the image file.
member.value: A object that contains the information about the image file, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if an error occurred.

remarks.para: This property contains the information about the image file. This instance is the same object returned from the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync method. While the asynchronous operation is running, the value of theRasterImage.IsLoading property will be true indicating that the object is being populated with the information and should not be used. When the asynchronous operation completes, the RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsyncCompleted event will fire and Info will contain the final and ready to use object. If an error occurs, this property will be set to null and the object is disposed internally by the toolkit.
When an error occur, either the Error property is not a null reference or the Cancelled property is true.

java.pre: public CodecsImageInfo getInfo()

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadAsyncCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains data for the RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event.

remarks.para: The class supports loading image files asynchronously using the RasterCodecs.LoadAsync methods. When calling any of these methods, the caller thread will not be blocked and the method will return instantly with an instance of that is in a loading status (theRasterImage.IsLoading property is set to true). Do not use the other properties of this object while the object is in loading status.
When the object finishes loading the image, the various properties of the will be populated with the image information and data and the RasterImage.IsLoading property will be set to false.

Do not poll the RasterImage.IsLoading property to determine whether the image is finished loaded. Instead, subscribe to the RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event to get notification when the operation is completed and whether any errors occurred.
The RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event data will also contain the same object returned from RasterCodecs.LoadAsync so you do not have to keep the original object in your application.
The RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event uses a data argument object of type . This class contains the following properties:

description.para: Contains the URI, stream or file name passed to the method that initialized this asynchronous operation.

Only one of these properties can be a valid value (not a null reference) at any time The property that contains a valid reference depends on what version of RasterCodecs.LoadAsync method has been called.

For example, if RasterCodecs.LoadAsync(Uri uri, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same URI passed to the method while and will both be null. If RasterCodecs.LoadAsync(String fileName, object userState) is being called, the will contain the same file name string value passed to the method while and will both be null and so on.

Contains the class instance that contains the image data being loaded. This instance is the same object returned from the RasterCodecs.LoadAsync method. While the asynchronous operation is running, the value of theRasterImage.IsLoading property will be true indicating that the object is being populated with the image information and should not be used. When the asynchronous operation completes, the RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event will fire and Image will contain the final and ready to use object. If an error occurs, this property will be set to null and the object is disposed internally by the toolkit.

Contains any errors that might have occurred during the asynchronous operation. You must check this value when the RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted event fires and make sure it does not contain a valid object.
Contains a value indicating whether an asynchronous operation has been canceled. For example, by calling RasterCodecs.CancelAsync when using RasterCodecs.LoadAsync with a URL

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.LoadAsyncCompleted.

java.pre: public class CodecsLoadAsyncCompletedEvent extends CodecsAsyncCompletedEvent

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode
member.summary: The handling mode for a file codec.

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS maintains a list of codecs used for querying for the file information.
Fixed codecs are never unloaded from the list. This makes the file detection of file formats very fast.
Dynamic codecs are dynamically unloaded when the number of loaded codecs exceeds the number set through RasterCodecs.PreloadCodecs.
Ignored codecs will never be used. You cannot load, save or obtain information on file formats normally handled by a codec that is ignored.
Once you save or load a file handled by a certain codec, that codec will be permanently loaded into memory. From that point on, setting the codecs load mode has no effect.

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetCodecInformation.

java.pre: public enum CodecsCodecLoadMode

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Dynamic
member.summary: The codec is dynamically loaded and freed as necessary.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Fixed
member.summary: The codec is loaded into memory and will never be unloaded. (This makes the file handling very fast).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecLoadMode.Ignored
member.summary: The codec is ignored. You cannot load, save or get the file information for any files normally handled by this codec.

member.summary: Gets and sets the load mode for the LEADTOOLS codec.
member.value: The load mode for the LEADTOOLS codec.
member.remarks: The LoadMode affects the behavior of RasterCodecs.Load, RasterCodecs.LoadAsync, RasterCodecs.GetInformation and RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync. This can be one of three values: Ignored (do not use this codec), Fixed (this codec is always loaded), Dynamic (this codec is load when needed, and unloaded when finished).

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecInformation.CheckedByInformation
member.summary: Identifies whether a particular file codec is used when processing a call to RasterCodecs.GetInformation or RasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync.
member.value: true if the filter codec is used; false, otherwise.
member.remarks: A call to has three phases used in identifying a file format. The first phase checks the first few bytes. The second phase checks the file extension. The third phase tries all available codec filters. When this value is 'false', the corresponding file codec is excluded from all phases.
member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetCodecInformation.

java.pre: public boolean getCheckedByInformation() public void setCheckedByInformation(boolean value)

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsCodecInformation.IsSlowInformation
member.summary: Identifies whether a particular file codec has been marked as taking a relatively long time to load a file.
member.value: true if the codec takes a long time to load a file; false, otherwise.
member.remarks: Value that indicates whether the codec takes a long time to load. There are three phases used in identifying a file format. The first phase checks the first few bytes. The second phase checks the file extension. The third phase tries all available codec filters. When this value is 'true', it means that the file format can not be identified by looking at the first few bytes of the file.
member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.GetCodecInformation.

java.pre: public boolean isSlowInformation()

member.summary: Enables and disables using the tile size when saving TIFF images.
member.value: true to use and when saving TIFF images.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTiffSaveOptions.TileWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the tile to use when saving TIFF files.
member.value: The width of the tile to use when saving TIFF files.

remarks.para: When saving TIFF files, the size of the tiles or strips saved in the file can be controlled. Some graphic packages cannot load TIFF files unless the files are saved with a certain tile or strip size. LEADTOOLS can load files of any strip and tile size, so modifying these settings is not necessary when saving files that will be loaded with LEADTOOLS.
If the Property is not true, then and are ignored. In this case, the image will be saved like in the previous versions of LEADTOOLS.

If is less than or equal to the image width, the image will be saved as tiles. If is greater than the image width, the image will be saved as strips. If the image is saved as tiles, controls the height of the tile. If the image is saved as strips, controls the height of the strip. The image can be saved as one strip by setting to a value greater than the image height.

java.pre: public int getTileWidth() public void setTileWidth(int value)

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTiffSaveOptions.TileHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the tile to use when saving TIFF files.
member.value: The height of the tile to use when saving TIFF files.

remarks.para: When saving TIFF files, the size of the tiles or strips saved in the file can be controlled. Some graphic packages cannot load TIFF files unless the files are saved with a certain tile or strip size. LEADTOOLS can load files of any strip and tile size, so modifying these settings is not necessary when saving files that will be loaded with LEADTOOLS.
If the Property is not true, then and are ignored. In this case, the image will be saved like in the previous versions of LEADTOOLS.

If is less than or equal to the image width, the image will be saved as tiles. If is greater than the image width, the image will be saved as strips. If the image is saved as tiles, controls the height of the tile. If the image is saved as strips, controls the height of the strip. The image can be saved as one strip by setting to a value greater than the image height.

java.pre: public int getTileHeight() public void setTileHeight(int value)

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsTiffSaveOptions.NoLzwAutoClear
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to automatically insert CLEAR codes during LZW compression.
member.value: true to disable insert of CLEAR codes; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This option can be used when saving TIFF LZW files. To save files compatible with some buggy LZW decoders that cannot handle early CLEAR codes. Some IBM decoders are known to have this problem. They will not decode LEAD TIFF LZW files unless this property is set to true.
This property is set to false by default, which allows LEADTOOLS to insert CLEAR LZW codes and reset the LZW compression engine if the compression ratio is not adequate.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXlsLoadOptions
member.summary: Provides the options for loading Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX) documents as a raster image.

remarks.para: Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX) files have no physical width or height in pixels. Use the to control how the final document is rendered as a raster image. For more information, refer to .
For more information, refer to File Formats - XLS/XLSX Format.

Important note: The XLS and XLSX file formats support only the following rasterization size modes:
CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None
CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.Fit
All other size modes will be treated as CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.Fit.

The XLS/XLSX file formats do not support loading a document using different horizontal or vertical resolutions. So if the value of CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.XResolution and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.YResolution are different, the XLS/XLSX codecs will use the larger of the two values as the resolution to use when rasterizing.

example.para: This example will load the given Excel 2003 file and render it as a raster image

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXlsLoadOptions.MultiPageSheet
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to draw multiple sheets per page.
member.value: true to draw multiple sheets per page if the final page size is greater than the sheet size, false to always draw one sheet per page.

remarks.para: Depending on the current rasterization options set with , the resulting physical render size of the page can hold more than one sheet. If the value of is set to true, then as many sheets as possible will be rendered on the same page if the size permits. Otherwise, exactly one sheet per page will be used.
Notice that if the sheet size is larger than the page size specified by the user, the sheet will be cropped regardless of the setting of this property.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXlsOptions
member.summary: Provides the options for loading or saving Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX) documents.

remarks.para: Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX) documents have no physical width or height in pixels. Use the to control how render the final object as a raster image. For more information, refer to .
Currently, LEADTOOLS does not support saving raster images as XLS/XLSX documents.
For more information, refer to File Formats - XLS/XLSX Format.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsXlsOptions.Load
member.summary: Gets the object to set the options for loading Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX)documents as raster images.
member.value: The XLS/XLSX options used to load Microsoft Excel 97-2003 (XLS) and Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 (XLSX) documents as a raster image.

member.summary: The transparency mask channel of the saved PSD layer.
member.value: A object that specifies the transparency mask channel of the saved PSD layer.

remarks.para: This is an 8-bit grayscale image. The value of each pixel indicates the amount of transparency the data of the original image has at this point. For example, if the value is 0xFF at a certain point, the pixel value of the layer image at that point is not transparent at all. If the value was 0x00, the pixel value of the layer image at that point is fully transparent. If the value is between these two, it indicates the degree of transparency the pixel value of the layer image has at that point.
When loading, if you set the property to true, then this property will hold an object that represents the transparency mask channel found in the PSD file.

If the mask image does not need to be loaded, pass false to . The value of will not be used. Passing false to saves the transparency mask as full white image, which represents full visibility of the layer.
When saving, if this is a valid image, then it should be of the same width and height as the corresponding layer image. It should also be an 8-bit grayscale image.
For more information, refer to FILE FORMATS SPECIFICATION from Adobe.

member.example: For an example, refer to RasterCodecs.LoadPsdLayer and RasterCodecs.SavePsdWithLayers.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions
member.summary: Contains set options for loading a document file as a raster image (rasterization).

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS provides support for loading a document as a raster image. Document formats such as PDF, XPS, DOC/DOCX(2007/2010), PPT/PPTX(2007/2010), XLS/XLSX(2007/2010), RTF and Text do not contain physical width, height or resolution information. It is up to the loader (in this case, the object) to specify the transformation from logical coordinates to physical pixels through a process called rasterization.

Rasterization is the process through which a document is converted into a raster image. To check whether a certain file on disk (or in a .NET stream) contains a document file rather than a regular raster image, call the RasterCodecs.GetInformationRasterCodecs.GetInformationAsync method and check the CodecsDocumentImageInfo.IsDocumentFile property. Here is a code snippet:

To rasterize a document file, set the properties of the to the required values. For example, the following code snippet will instruct LEADTOOLS to fit any document files into 8.5 by 11 inches paper size at 300 dpi resolution. Every document file loaded with the RasterCodecs.Load or RasterCodecs.LoadAsync methods will have width/height of no more than 2550 by 3300 pixels with a resolution of 300 by 300:
The class contains the following properties:

description.para: The resulting page width and height (in ). The value of the resulting raster image width and height in pixels depends on the current resolution and size mode values.
The size of the margins to leave on the left, top, right and bottom margins using as the unit of measure. Currently, only RTF and TXT documents support margins.
The units to use for the , , , , and values.

The resolution to use when rasterizing the document files. A value of 0 means to use the current screen resolution (usually 96). The resolution controls the pixel density of the resulting raster image. For example, if you specify 8.5 by 11 inches page width and height and a resolution of 96, the resulting image will have a pixel width and height of (8.5 * 96 = 816) and (11 * 96 = 1056) pixels. This is suitable for viewing at a 100 percent zoom but when you start zooming in, the image will get pixelated. Pixelation may also occur if you send the raster image to a printer, since printers usually have much higher resolution than a monitor.

If zooming in or high quality printing is a requirement in your code, then a higher resolution value must be specified (for example, 300 by 300). For an 8.5 by 11 inch document, this results in a raster image size of (8.5 * 300 = 2550) and (11 * 300 = 3300) pixels, which is more than suitable for printing or zooming in. Keep in mind that increasing the resolution will increase the memory used to hold the image data. Finding the right balance between pixel density and memory consumption depends upon your application needs.
Controls the transformation used when converting the logical size specified in page width and height to the physical raster image size. Refer to for more information.

remarks.para: Refer to the C# and VB Rasterize Document Demo that ships with your version of LEADTOOLS for an interactive demonstration of .

example.para: This example will load a PDF document using different rasterize document options and show its effect on the resulting raster image width, height and resolution.

member.value: A value that indicates the resulting suggested width in . Default value is 8.5 inches. The value of must be greater than 0.

remarks.para: The value of the resulting raster image width and height in pixels depends on the current resolution and size mode values. For more information refer to .
Use to set the resulting raster image suggested height. and are in .
When the value of is set to CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None, the original document size is kept and hence and will not be used.

Use to set the resulting raster image suggested height. Both and are in .
When the value of is set to CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None, the original document size is kept and hence and will not be used.

remarks.para: When using a pixel unit (CodecsRasterizeDocumentUnit.Pixel), the page width and height are multiplied by the current resolution( and ) to determine the final physical page size).

The page width, height or margins are in inches

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.XResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution to use when rasterization document files.
member.value: An value that indicates the horizontal resolution to use when rasterization occurs on document files such as PDF and XPS. A value of 0 means use the current screen resolution. The default value is 150.

remarks.para: The resolution controls the pixel density of the resulting raster image. For example, if you specify 8.5 by 11 inches page width and height and a resolution of 96, the resulting image will have a pixel width and height of (8.5 * 96 = 816) and (11 * 96 = 1056) pixels. This is suitable for viewing at a 100 percent zoom but when you start zooming in, the image will get pixelated. Pixelation can also occur when sending the raster image to a printer, since printers usually have much higher resolution than a screen.

If zooming in or high quality printing is a requirement in your code, then a higher resolution value must be specified, for example 300 by 300. For an 8.5 by 11 inches document, this results in a raster image size if (8.5 * 300 = 2550) and (11 * 300 = 3300) pixels. More than suitable for printing or zooming in. Keep in mind that increasing the resolution will increase the memory used to hold the image data. Finding the right balance between pixel density and memory consumption depends on your application needs.
After the is loaded, the image resolution set in RasterImage.XResolution and RasterImage.YResolution will be the same as and .
The vertical resolution is specified in . For most normal usage, the values of and should be equal.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.YResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution to use for rasterization document files.
member.value: An value that indicates the vertical resolution to use for rasterization document files such as PDF and XPS. A value of 0 means to use the current screen resolution. The default value is 150.

remarks.para: The resolution controls the pixel density of the resulting raster image. For example, if you specify 8.5 by 11 inches page width and height and a resolution of 96, the resulting image will have a pixel width and height of (8.5 * 96 = 816) and (11 * 96 = 1056) pixels. This is suitable for viewing at a 100 percent zoom but when you start zooming in, the image will get pixelated. Pixelation can also occur if you send the raster image to a printer, since printers usually have much higher resolution than a screen.

If zooming in or high quality printing is a requirement in your code, then a higher resolution value must be specified, for example 300 by 300. For an 8.5 by 11 inch document, this results in a raster image size if (8.5 * 300 = 2550) and (11 * 300 = 3300) pixels. More than suitable for printing or zooming in. Keep in mind that increasing the resolution increases the memory used to hold the image data. Finding the right balance between pixel density and memory consumption depends on the application's needs.
After the is loaded, the image resolution set in RasterImage.XResolution and RasterImage.YResolution will be the same as and .
The horizontal resolution is specified in . For most normal usage, the value of and should be equal.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.SizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the transformation to use when converting the logical size specified in and to the final physical raster image size.
member.value: A enumeration member that indicates the transformation to use when converting the logical size specified in and to the final physical raster image size. Default value is CodecsRasterizeDocumentSizeMode.None.

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS provides support for loading a document as a raster image. Document formats such as PDF, XPS, DOC/DOCX(2007/2010), PPT/PPTX(2007/2010), XLS/XLSX(2007/2010), RTF and Text do not contain physical width, height or resolution. It is up to the loader (in this case, the object) to specify the transformation from logical coordinates to physical pixels through a process called rasterization. For more information, refer to .

You can use the property to specify how to use and to control the final raster image size. LEADTOOLS will determine the original document size (a value that can be obtained in CodecsDocumentImageInfo.PageWidth and CodecsDocumentImageInfo.PageHeight) and then apply the transformation from this value to determine the final width and height as follows:

description.para: Use the original document width and height. No transformation will be performed and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight are not used.
The final will have a width or height value equals to the original document size.

Fit the resulting raster image into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight while maintaining the aspect ratio. If the original document size is smaller than the requested page size, no transformation is performed.
The final will have a width or height equal to or less than the requested page width or height but not greater.

Always fit the resulting raster image into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight while maintaining the aspect ratio. If the original document size is smaller than the requested page size, then the resulting image is scaled up.
The final will have a width or height equal to the requested page width or height. Not less and not greater.

Fit the resulting raster image width into CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth while maintaining the aspect ratio. The image height will be calculated based on the transformation and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight is not used.
The final will have a width equal to the requested page width. The height depends on the original document height.

The resulting raster image width and height will be exactly equal to CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageWidth and CodecsRasterizeDocumentLoadOptions.PageHeight. The aspect ratio can be different than the original document.
The final will have a width and height equal to the requested page width and height.
